## Introduction to Econometrics (Econ 4261, Undergraduate)

[A first course](http://www.josephlyonmullins.com/Econ4261/) in econometrics for students with knowledge of statistics and linear algebra.

## Applied Econometrics (Econ 8208, PhD)

[A first year PhD course](http://www.josephlyonmullins.com/econometrics-phd/) in structural econometrics.

## Wages and Employment (Econ 8502, PhD)

Despite the name, [a second year PhD course](https://josephmullins.github.io/structural-methods/) covering methods in structural econometrics, with an emphasis on identification and estimation of dynamic structural models.
